http://www.weather.com/outlook/weather-news/news/articles/march-tornado-severe-weather_2012-03-15

http://www.weather.com/outlook/weather-news/news/articles/michigan-tornado-images_2012-03-16

They hit just east of me, near Dexter.

Nobody\'s been killed, thankfully, but there\'s a lot of property damage... The generally accepted reason is due to the unusually high temperatures for this time of year - It\'s been 80+ degrees F around here, which is, depending on the location, approaching or slightly above the highest ever recorded temperature for the date.

I forgot, you live in the same general area that I do...

Yeah, I heard about the tornadoes. Apparently, one of the people from 107.1 FM got a video from pretty close by. Pardon the language...
I am glad i moved-from michigian to arizona
Im glad I don\'t get tornadoes here, or firestorms, or droughts.

Im glad I don\'t get tornadoes here, or firestorms, or droughts.

The earthquakes are only a minor inconvenience.

The earthquakes are only a minor inconvenience.

They are once in 15 year things (well, for christchurch its once in 200 years but you get the picture), and unlike tornados, earthquakes are fun. And yes, I am screwed in the head somewhat.

*raises hand*

Will we still get mods?

...wait, Nova, you\'re in SE MI, too?

(Howell here, about 30 miles NNW of where these ones hit.)
